properties.name: 181 Goldhurst Terrace, London, England
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridegoldhurst terrace, london, englandThe house where I lived during my sophophore year of college, 1989. It was a flat on the top floor of a Victorian rowhouse owned by a fairly nasty old couple. I shared it with three other students from St. Lawrence University, none of whom I ever saw again. Living in London was an amazing experience - my first chance to live on my own and get away from the Northeastern U.S.

properties.name: A favorite place to satisfy my crustacean addiction, Provincetown, Massachusetts
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride85 Shank Painter Rd., Provincetown, MAThis is Clem & Ursies, a cool little restaurant that\'s a bit off the beaten path in Provincetown. If there\'s one restaurant here that I *must* visit anytime I\'m here (and I\'m here at least once a year), it\'s this one. I get a hot "lazy" lobster roll in a hot dog bun and a dish of Almond Joy ice cream for dessert. But there\'s plenty of other good food here, too (and strong martinis). Provincetown was really the first "gay" place I ever visited. I came up alone for a week in June of 1994 and stayed at a gay inn. I met a guy who also went to my alma mater, the aggressively hetero St. Lawrence University (well, I went there for two years before transferring), at a bar one night, and that led to some interesting fun. I ate well, enjoyed the sea air, and wrote one of my first chapters for Fodor\'s Gay Guide to the USA. I was 23, and spending a week in a largely gay resort town was still a big novelty to me. Now I come back here regularly to update the Outer Cape chapter of Fodor\'s Cape Cod, and I usually come in late April. There are few crowds now. Provincetown has changed a lot in the decade - became snazzier, more upscale, less avowedly gay but still very welcoming of everybody. It\'s still one of my favorite places - one of the relatively few places in the world I feel very much at home. Although I think if I lived out in this part of the world, I\'d want to be on Martha\'s Vineyard - that\'s truly one of my favorite places on earth (and where I am as I type this).

properties.name: Alone on an Island, Martha's Vineyard
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride12 Crocker Ave., Vineyard Haven, MAI\'m working right now on Fodor\'s Cape Cod, and I\'m in one of my absolute favorite places. I don\'t know why, but I\'m often happiest when I\'m on an island. There\'s something about the forced separateness, and I\'m fascinated that virtually everything on the island that didn\'t grow here arrived on one of the same ferry boats that brought me and my rental car early today (it\'s April 27, 2006). I\'m staying at the Crocker House Inn, a great B&B that\'s in my favorite town on Martha\'s Vineyard, called Vineyard Haven. It\'s the quieter part of the island, but there are still some good places to eat and explore within walking distance. I went for a 5-mile jog when I got here this evening, up around West Chop Lighthouse (just scroll up Main Street to the north on the map). Tomorrow I\'ll spend pretty much the entire day touring inns and restaurants, which would probably bore plenty of people to death, but it\'s a fun job to me. I scarfed down four huge homemade chocolate-chip cookies right before my jog tonight, and I\'m thinking that\'s going to become my new work-out routine.

properties.name: Alpharetta, Georgia
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridewindcreek overlook, alpharetta, gaThis is where my sister Robin and her then-husband lived in the early \'90s. I lived here for a few months in early 1995, while dating Keller (and also living part-time with him, in nearby Roswell)

properties.name: An Econolodge in Escanaba, Michigan
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideEscanaba, MichiganIn my quest to visit every one of the nation\'s 3,143 counties, I reached the halfway point when I entered Delta County, in Michigan, in early September, 2002. I spent the night at a lovely Econolodge in the not especially interesting town of Escanaba.

properties.name: Bird Key, Sarasota, Florida
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride609 S. Owl Dr., Sarasota, FloridaThis is where my maternal grandparents lived from the 1960s until roughly the early 1980s. I spent a week here every school spring break as a kid. Technically, it was the home of my grandmother and her fourth husband, but for all practical purposes, although he was not related to me by blood, I thought of him as my actual grandfather. Bird Key was (and is to an even greater extent today) this ritzy, gated, planned island community off the coast of Sarasota. As a kid, I soaked up as much of the island\'s exclusivity as I possibly could, latching on to its glamorous sense of entitlement and privilege as though I lived there. We used to go to the Bird Key Yacht Club for many of our meals. My grandparents didn\'t own a yacht, but that didn\'t seem to matter much. I remember developing a taste for Vichyssoise soup and thinking this also connoted a sense of wealth and importance. Oddly, as much as I love food today, I don\'t really care much for that particular soup. As a kid, I hated to master new skills in front of other people - I didn\'t like to appear as though I didn\'t know how to do something. So when I was 8 years old, my fear was learning to ride a bike in front of the other kids in my neighborhood in New Jersey. That year when we visited my grandparents on Bird Key, my mom rented a bike, and she spent the week teaching me to ride it. I came returned home fully versed in the ins and outs of bicycling and avoided the plague of looking incompetent in front of my friends. That is my strongest memory related to Bird Key...that and the hundreds of little lizards that used to race up and down the screened-in porch...and the Vichyssoise.

properties.name: Boerum Hill, Brooklyn, New York
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridebergen st., brooklyn, nyThis is where friends of mine at the time, Craig and Syl, had a house, and I lived off-and-on in their guest room at various times in 1995 and 1996

properties.name: Bournemouth, England
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridebournemouth, englandThis is where I spent a random weekend, alone, in February 1989. I didn\'t tell anybody where I was going, and so it\'s the first time in my life that I was completely unaccounted for and on my own, with not a soul in the world knowing exactly where I was. I think that probabaly set me on course to become a travel writer...

properties.name: Brady Theatre, Tulsa, Oklahoma
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideÂ 105 W. Brady St., Tulsa, OkThis was the destination of the first trip Mike and I ever made together, in late March of 2003. We spent two nights in Oklahoma, going to see a Tori Amos concert in Tulsa. It was an awfully long way to go for her, but we had fun.

properties.name: Burkhart's bar
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridepiedmont ave. ne, atlanta, gaWhere I met my second serious boyfriend, in October 1994 (we dated until April 1995)

properties.name: Cabrillo National Monument, San Diego, California
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridecabrillo road, san diego, californiaAnother all-time favorite trip. Mike and I spent a week in California in January 2006, but the best part was in San Diego. And we had an especially good time wandering around Cabrillo National Monument taking pictures and enjoying the views.

properties.name: Camino San Acacio, Santa Fe, New Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride1005 Camino San Acacio, Santa Fe, NMThis is where I lived from 2001 to 2005. The first couple of years I lived in the apartment behind the main house, with Kaline and the two cats we adopted, Mary and Mister Grant. The he and I split up, and I moved into one of the apartments in the main house, along with the cats.

properties.name: Camp Belknap, Wolfeboro, New Hampshire
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridewolfeboro, nhA YMCA camp where I spent two miserable weeks during the summers of both 1978 and 1979. I have rarely been so unhappy in my life. Something about having to forced congregating with masses of bothersome kids and having to adhere to any kind of schedule during the sacred summer months.

properties.name: Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, New York
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride144 luquer st., brooklyn, nyThis is the site of my first ever apartment in New York City. I moved here in June 1991 with a couple of friends from college, and we lived here for about 8 months

properties.name: Chance encounter #3, An Open Book, Columbus, OH
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride641 N. High Street, Columbus, ohThis is the former site of An Open Book, a bookstore where Kaline and I met in June 1996 (and where I spent a lot of time until 2001, when we moved to New Mexico). We dated for 7 years. I had been invited there to do a book-signing/discussion for my first guidebook, Fodor\'s Gay Guide to the USA. Kaline was working there behind the register, and when his boss asked me if I\'d like to have drinks after my speaking gig, I agreed on the condition that Kaline join us, too. My publicist nearly cancelled my appearance because she doubted I\'d want to bother traveling all the way to "the middle of Ohio" to promote my book. I instructed her otherwise, because I had been to Columbus once before and got a good vibe from the city (and that bookstore). Lesson: Always follow your intuitions.

properties.name: Church Street Village, Toronto, Canada
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridetoronto, canadaThis is where I spent some time late in 1995 and early 1996, while dating a guy named Tom.

properties.name: Crashing the 'bile, Daniels Summit, Heber City, Utah
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideEast Main Canyon Road, Heber City, UtahThis is where I learned to ride - and crash, in spectacular fashion - a snowmobile, in March 2006

properties.name: Dakota restaurant, Covington, Louisiana
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideÂ Covington, LouisianaThe restaurant where I first met my friend Donna, who\'s the Director of St. Tammany Parish/North Shore New Orleans tourism, in December 2002.

properties.name: Dominica
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxiridedominicaThis is one of the two islands I spent part of early winter 2003, right after I left Fodor\'s to go freelance and spent the winter covering the Caribbean and cruise ship industry.

properties.name: East Village, New York City
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride17 1st Avenue, New York, NYThis is where I lived from mid-1996 to mid-1998, with a roommate I met in a newspaper ad, and also with Kaline for a time. It\'s also where I met Yoav, at my own birthday party, during a period when Kaline and I were "off". Yoav and I dated (also "off-and-on") for a couple of years, in 1998 and 1999.

properties.name: First home in Santa Fe, on Alto Street
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridealto street, santa fe, nmI rented a small cottage behind the main house here when I first moved to Santa Fe, in February 2000. Then Kaline and I lived here briefly while we looked for a more permanent home the following year January. It\'s a great neighborhood, on the edge of the Guadalupe District, an easy walk from The Cowgirl (great cas-American food and arguably the least competent - but still friendly - service in town) and some other fun places to eat and shop.

properties.name: First time on the other side, The Works, New York City
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride428 Columbus Ave., New York, NY This was the very first gay bar I ever set foot in...the first of well more than 1,000...maybe 2,000? It was March 1992, and the experience proved fortuitous - I met a cute Columbia University grad student from Peru, and we wandered back to his place. It was never so easy to walk up to a stranger and buy him a beer, probably because I didn\'t know any better. His name was Andreas, and I never saw him again. My friend Bob had taken me to the bar, thinking I was straight and merely being a good sport to go with him. When I told Bob I was leaving with this new friend, he grabbed my shoulder in a panic and asked if I understood exactly *what* the guy had in mind. I assured Bob that I knew exactly what I was in for (or at least hoped I was in for), and so began my sordid life of gay-bar-hopping.

properties.name: Flying Star
properties.description: Posted by UnmguyÂ Â 3416 Central Ave Se Albuquerque NM

properties.name: Flying Star Cafe, Nob Hill, Albuquerque
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideÂ 3416 Central Ave. SE, Albuquerque, NMApart from being my unofficial outside-of-the-home freelancers office, Flying Star is where I met my boyfriend, Mike, in July 2002. Actually, mostly I hang out at the branch of Flying Star that\'s nearer to my house (it\'s up on Juan Tabo, near Montgomery). But this one, in Nob Hill not far from University of New Mexico, tends to have the better people-watching. Mike and I had actually "chatted" a bunch of times online before we agreed to meet here for coffee, and as I was not single at the time, it wasn\'t truly a date. I\'ll spare the world the full details except to say that I remember walking up toward the front door and immediately recognizing Mike from his picture. He was wearing big black shoes. The rest, as they say, is history.

properties.name: Former Ritz-Carlton, Sydney, Australia
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridesydney, australiaThis was my first trip outside North America or Europe, with my good friend Michelle in 1994. We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton near the Opera House, which is now the Sir Stamford Hotel I think. I was back in Australia for a while in March 2005 and would really like to go as often as possible.

properties.name: Former site of Amnesia nightclub, Memphis, Tennessee
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride2899 Poplar Ave., Memphis, TennesseeAt this club, during a cross-country trip with Kaline in summer 1997, I met Trae, Kenneth, and Mickey, who were all students from Oxford, Mississippi visiting the club that night. I\'ve met, eh, lots and lots of people in my travels, and especially at bars. But somehow I\'ve managed to stay friends with all three of these guys (Mickey now lives in New York City, Kennith in Salt Lake City, and Trae in Kansas City).

properties.name: Former site of Random House, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride201 E. 50th St., New York, NYWhere Fodor\'s Travel Publications (part of Random House) used to be located (they\'re now closer to Times Square) This was the first place I worked after college, and the only place I\'ve worked on staff full-time as an adult. I began in June 1991 and quit to go freelance in September 1993. We were on the 29th floor and then were moved, unceremoniously, to the 4th floor. I had my own office, which was highly satisfying at age 22. I met some of the people I still consider my closest friends - such as Bob (currently the map editor at Fodor\'s), Marcy, Edie - during my somewhat short tenure there. I\'ve been working steadily for Fodor\'s as a freelancer since that time.

properties.name: Gammage Auditorium, Tempe, Arizona
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride64 E. Apache Blvd., Tempe, ArizonaThis is the first place I ever saw Tori Amos in concert, in December 2002. I went with Kaline, and Mike was there, too, although I didn\'t actually see him there (a long story). I\'ve seen her a few more times since, and she\'s by far my favorite person to see perform.

properties.name: Giving away a bride, Belvedere Hotel, Baltimore, Maryland
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideÂ 1 East Chase St., Baltimore, MDThis is probably the only time in my life that I\'ll "give away" a bride at her wedding. The wedding was my good friend Valerie (to Moe), and because her father\'s an ass, I got to walk her down the aisle in his place. Valerie and I met at Wesleyan and bonded during late-night grocery store raids for pumpkin pie, ice cream, and liquor.

properties.name: Gradyville, Pennsylvania
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridegradyville, paThis is where my father grew up and where my grandmother lived until the late 1980s before moving to Connecticut. I spent lots of time here as a kid.

properties.name: Greenwich Village, New York City
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride23 Barrow St., New York, NYThis is the first apartment I ever lived in all by myself, in summer 1993. It was 180 square feet. It was shaped like a subway car, and when I stood in the middle of it, I could touch both walls. It has a working fireplace, but I didn\'t use it, because I needed the space (it held one end of my futon).

properties.name: Hayes Valley, San Francisco, California
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideFillmore St., San Francisco, CAThis is the apartment my friend Michelle first lived when she moved to San Francisco. I spent a couple of months here in March and April 1996, right after she moved out here.

properties.name: Heritage Village, Southbury, Connecticut
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideSouthbury, CTI lived here sporadically (during my nomad years) from 1993 to 1996. It was the home of my grandmother, Anne Collins, who lived here from the late \'80s until she died in spring 2005.

properties.name: Home!
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride8100 wyoming blvd., albuquerque, nmDid ya really think I was going to post the exact location of my current home on here? Well, this is in the general vicinity - within a half-mile or so of where I live (along with Mike and the various catties and doggies). I moved here in November 2005. It\'s a nice, comfy house with lots of room to kick around. But I\'ve always lived in odd houses in generally offbeat neighborhoods with lots of character, and this area is right out of Edward Scissorhands. It\'s a little creepy. I\'ve been here six months and not a single neighbor has spoken a word to us. It\'s the world of attached two-car garages. The odds of my living here for more than two years are pretty slim...watch out Portland (OR) and San Diego, you\'re both hot on my list...

properties.name: Lower Town, Quebec City, Quebec, Canada
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideQuebec City, Quebec, CanadaThis was the terminus of my first true road trip, which I embarked with two friends during Finals week in college in December 1988. We left from St. Lawrence University and drove to Ottawa, Canada for breakfast. Then we decided to continue to Montreal for lunch, but overshot it and continued to Quebec City. We returned through Montreal, and by then it was very late, so we had dinner and checked into a cheap hotel. In the morning, we returned to school. This gave me a sufficient taste for road-trips to make me want to go on many, many more.

properties.name: My checkered past, Westfield, New Jersey
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride545 hanford place, westfield, njThis is the house where I lived from 1969 to June 1978 (until the age of 9). That year the insurance company my father worked for moved to Stamford, Connecticut, and so, although it made no sense to me, we moved as well. I was not happy about this turn of events - in fact, I fell into a state of peevish rage and tantrum-throwing for a good two years after the move. Eventually, though, I grew to love the Stepford-esque environs of Fairfield County, Connecticut. Westfield is notorious as the town in which a seemingly innocuous, God-fearing executive named John List murdered his mother, wife, and three children in their palatial Victorian mansion, and then disappeared before the police could arrest him. The year was 1971. He settled somewhere in the South and started a brand-new life, only to be snagged some 25 years later after the airing of an "America\'s Most Wanted." It\'s also the town where two nine-year-old boys shoplifted Starbursts, Necco Wafers (who would actually pay for these?), and Snickers bars from the downtown Woolworth\'s one humid late-spring day in 1978, only to be nabbed by an observant employee. I was one of the boys, my friend Rob the other. The store manager threatened to call the cops but let us go on the proviso that we never set foot in that store again. My family moved to Connecticut four days later, and I never did return. I never saw Rob again...

properties.name: Mykonos, Greece
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideMykonos, GreeceThis is the first resort place I ever vacationed that had a visible gay scene. It was during my summer travels of 1989, backpacking around Europe, and I was not out and didn\'t actually have the guts to go to any gay clubs. Strangely, even as a travel writer, I\'ve never been back - one of these days, hopefully.

properties.name: Nearly puking in a boat, Tofino, British Columbia
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideTofino, British Columbia, CanadaThis is roughly where I nearly threw up, again and again and again, while attempting to "whale-watch" off the coast of Tofino, a very cool, offbeat town on Vancouver Island. Why do people derive joy from venturing out in choppy seas on a small, rocky boat to catch *maybe* a glimpse of a whale\'s ass arcing over the water? Of course, when the captain see\'s a whale, he slows down the boat...so it pitches and rocks even harder. I\'ve rarely been so miserable. On the plus, I went sea-kayaking (one of my favorite hobbies) the following morning and had a blast, even in the pouring rain...

properties.name: Outrigger Reef Hotel, Honolulu, Hawaii
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideÂ 2169 Kalia Rd., Honolulu, HawaiiThis is where I spent the first night of one of my favorite trips, to Hawaii with Kaline in fall of 1998. We had this great rooftop bungalow with amazing views of Waikiki. We had more fun on the other islands - Maui, Big Island, and Kuaui. But that first night was very memorable.

properties.name: Oxford, England
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxirideoxford, englandThis is where i spent part of the summer of 1989, taking courses and living in a spare guest room of a woman\'s house at 10 Green Street.

properties.name: Oz Nightclub
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride800 Bourbon St., New Orleans, laWhere I met my first serious boyfriend, Woody, in September 1993 (we dated for about six months)

properties.name: Peaceful views, Arroyo Seco, New Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridearroyo seco, nmI rented a house here for a couple of weeks during the summers of both 1998 and 1999, and these experiences ultimately helped convince me to move to New Mexico. The house was off of Rim Road, which sat high above the village of Valdez, and I used to just stand there looking at the village and then gazing out at the 50-mile views to the west, thinking there are few places on earth more peaceful and mesmerizing. Yoav stayed with me here the first summer, along with Susan, Valerie, and some other friends. Kaline and his grandma came the second summer. I was back here the last time, renting a different nearby house with my parents, a few years ago. We awakened one day to a beautiful, clear-skied, sunny morning, but what we soon saw on our one fuzzy television channel later that morning cut short our vacation. The day, if you haven\'t guessed, was September 11, 2001. So now when I go back to Arroyo Seco, the view seems less peaceful, but it\'s still mesmerizing.

properties.name: Roxbury, Connecticut
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridejudge road, roxbury, ctThis is where my parents have lived since around 2002, when my father retired. I still spend a lot of time here - it\'s my main base when I\'m back in the Northeast for work.

properties.name: Sofa-surfing in Chelsea, New York City
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride260 W. 15th St., New York, NYThis is the apartment building my friends Marcy and Mark lived in during much of the 1990s. I lived off-and-on at Marcy\'s place for a bit of 1995 (during Nomadic Stint No. 1), and when I was too drunk to make it up another flight of stairs, I usually found myself sleeping at Mark\'s place on the futon or floor or wherever. Marcy used to pick all the bits of dough and chocolate out of the pints of Ben & Jerry\'s Choc Chip Cookie Dough ice cream I bought and leave me with a container of re-frozen vanilla. But then again, she never charged me rent.

properties.name: South End, Boston, Massachusetts
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride150 Warren Ave., boston, maThis is where my friend Susan lived from the mid-\'90s till the early \'00s. I spent a lot of time here, and actually lived here off and on during my second nomadic period, from 1998 to 2000.

properties.name: St. Lawrence University
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideCanton, New YorkWhere I went to college from 1987 to 1989 (before transferring to Wesleyan)

properties.name: St. Lucia
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridest. luciaThis is one of the two islands I spent part of early winter 2003, right after I left Fodor\'s to go freelance and spent the winter covering the Caribbean and cruise ship industry.

properties.name: St. Moritz, Switzerland
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideSt. Moritz, SwitzerlandI met one of my very closest friend, Katie, in St. Moritz in September 2004, while attending a travel writers conference. It was part of a five-week trip during which I also went to Paris, Nice, Cannes, Barcelona, and Madrid. I think if I could live in any European city, it would be Barcelona.

properties.name: Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideTaos Ski Valley, New MexicoThis is where I *finally* learned to ski, in February 2005.

properties.name: Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxirideanchorage, alaskaWhen my plane landed on the runway at the airport in Anchorage in early May 2005, I had finally visited all 50 states. I was there for a conference in nearby Girdwood, and then I spent several days in Juneau, which I liked even more.

properties.name: The Leidseplein, Amsterdam, Netherlands
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxirideamsterdam, netherlandsI rented a flat on Korte Leidsewarstraat, near the Leidseplein square, for a couple of months in November and December of 1997 while I research Fodor\'s Gay Guide to Amsterdam. Kaline flew over and we had a great time here and going to Belgium. I don\'t remember all that much else...just a lot of brownies.

properties.name: The Riddle of my life, Media, Pennsylvania
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride1068 w. baltimore pike, media, paThis is the Riddle Memorial Hospital, where I was born, at about 2:30 a.m. on March 3, 1969, during a horrible snow storm. My mom says they had to attach chains to the ambulance tires to get her from house to hospital bed. We continued to live in the town of Media until summer of that year, when my father\'s job took us to New Jersey. I still love snowy nights...

properties.name: The house that got away, Eldorado, New Mexico
properties.description: Posted by OnalongtaxirideEldorado, near Santa Fe, New MexicoAfter living short-term at Alto Street with Kaline for a couple of months, in mid-March 2001, I found myself under contract to buy this house in Eldorado, about a 20-minute drive outside of town. I was a week away from closing, when a snafu occurred regarding my financing (let\'s just say I was stretched to the max). The deal fell through. And the second it fell through, I breathed a huge sigh of relief. It would have been too much house for my wallet, although a great investment. And I really didn\'t move to Santa Fe to live out in a subdivision away from all the action, even if this is a very nice subdivision. So remember, if your plans run awry, it\'s probably just fine - it\'s perhaps even a blessing. We end up where we\'re supposed to. I do occasionally drive by, however, and wonder what might have been...

properties.name: Upper West Side, New York, NY
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride172 W. 79th St., New York, NYThis was my second apartment, in Manhattan, where I lived with my friend Matthew for about a year in 1992. (It was also a sporadic home base for a few years after I moved out and was living nomadically)

properties.name: Washington, New Hampshire
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxirideold haying rd, washington, nhThis is my parents\' weekend house, and it was also my home base from summer 1998 until I moved to Santa Fe, New Mexico, in 2000

properties.name: Watch Rock Point, Long Lake, New York
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridelong lake, new yorkWatch Rock Point was a compound of houses and outbuildings my grandfather owned for many decades, and where I spent several weeks each summer as a kid throughout the 1970s.

properties.name: Wesleyan University
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridehigh st., middletown, ctWhere I attended college from 1989 to 1991 (graduated in spring 1991)

properties.name: West Greenwich Village, New York City
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride10 Morton St., New York, NYThis was the apartment of my friend Ruth\'s, and I spent extended periods here pet/house-sitting for her, mostly in 1995 and 1996.

properties.name: Wilton, Connecticut
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiride66 Washington Post Dr., Wilton, CTThis is the house I lived in from 1978 to 1987, when I graduated from Wilton High School and went on to college. Of course, this was this house was site of many firsts for me (the usual firsts involving sex, drugs, alcohol). I continued to live there during summers until graduating from college and moving to New York City (see Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn)

properties.name: Zurich, Switzerland
properties.description: Posted by Onalongtaxiridezurich, switzerlandThis is where I was when I phoned home in summer 1989 and learned that my application to transfer to Wesleyan University had been accepted. It really didn\'t seem like a big deal at the time, but that transfer ultimately changed my career path and launched me on the road to becoming a travel writer.
